context: this is an 81-year-old gentleman who underwent septorhinoplasty many years ago.
a diagnosis of diffuse invasive squamous cell carcinoma was rendered.
he has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years and has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.
he has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years and has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.
he has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years and has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.
he has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years and has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.
the preoperative examination shows induration of the nasal tip without significant erythema.
there is focal tenderness just cephalad to the alar crease.
there is no lesion either externally or intranasally.
there was slight asymmetry of the nares.
random biopsies of the submucosal tissue were taken and submitted to pathology for frozen section.
an alar incision was made with a #15 blade and the full-thickness incision was completed with the electrocautery.
additional soft tissue was then taken from all margins tagging them for the pathologist.
there was still disease present in the region of the upper lateral cartilage at its insertion with the nasal bone.
xeroform gauze was then fashioned to cover the defect and was sutured along the periphery of the wound with interrupted 6-0 nylon suture to provide a barrier and moisture.
